That's a great approach! Starting with the first season will give you a chance to get familiar with the characters, the setting, and the tone of the show. You can then decide if you want to continue with the subsequent seasons.

With your consistent evening routine, you'll be able to make steady progress through the series. Remember to take breaks in between episodes to process what you've watched and to appreciate the details that make The Crown so exceptional.

As you watch the first season, pay attention to the:

1. Impeccable production design: The Crown's attention to detail in recreating the 1940s and 1950s is stunning. From the costumes to the sets, every aspect is meticulously crafted.
2. Outstanding performances: Claire Foy's portrayal of Queen Elizabeth II is phenomenal, and the supporting cast is equally impressive.
3. Historical context: The show does an excellent job of weaving historical events into the narrative, making it both entertaining and educational.
4. Character development: The Crown explores the complexities of the royal family, revealing their struggles, relationships, and personalities.

Feel free to reach out if you have any questions or need further recommendations. Enjoy your evening routine, and I hope you'll find The Crown to be a great addition to it!
